issue.title: Solved issue #330: Implement RtHooksITCase.canFetchAllHooks

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
A note:

The test canFetchAllHooks passes, however the complete integration test fails, please see https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/353

looks like a bug, thanks for reporting (although I don't think it's related to the parallel execution)
@yegor256 sure! @hariso thanks for reporting, 15 mins was added to your account (trn ID: `DA2138056`)

issue.title: Solved issue #330: Implement RtHooksITCase.canFetchAllHooks

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body:
Note:

Because of: https://github.com/jcabi/jcabi-github/issues/353, integration tests may be failing. However, running only the test method RtHooksITCase.canFetchAllHooks() correctly verifies if iterating through all the hooks works.

body:
I've got the same error. I think the exceptions occur because the test methods with hook creation are run in different threads. On the first request for hook creation a response with status 201 is returned:

```
$ curl -v -X POST -H "Authorization: token ..." "https://api.github.com/repos/asinyagin/test-repo/hooks" -d '{"name":"geocommit","config":{}}'
...
< Status: 201 Created
...
  "id": 1738132,
```

on the second request a response with status 200 is returned:

```
$ curl -v -X POST -H "Authorization: token ..." "https://api.github.com/repos/asinyagin/test-repo/hooks" -d '{"name":"geocommit","config":{}}'
...
< Status: 200 OK
...
  "id": 1738132,
```

Looks like Github treats the second request as update of the created hook. This results in the `AssertionError`.

To fix the error we might disable parallel execution of methods or use different service in each integration test for hooks.
